intro: Halenia candida, commonly known as the white halenia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a smooth, glossy surface. Halenia candida is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and stream banks.
